input_text:
Job Title: Robotics/Assembly Maintenance Technician

Location: Clinton, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Number: 63921

Group: Cosma International

Division: Eaglebend Manufacturing

Job Type: Permanent/Regular

Location: CLINTON

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

Role Summary

Cosma Eagle Bend Manufacturing, a division of Magna International Inc., is hiring an Maintenance Industrial Machine Repair Tech for our Assembly Department. Assembly Maintenance Technician will provide technical support for production and carry out the assignments and responsibilities given to them by the Assembly Maintenance Supervisors and Team Leaders.

At Eagle Bend Manufacturing we promote opportunities within the company, fair culture and concern for people, recognizes that your engagement and commitment is fundamental to our business success.#WeAreMagnaMagna,

Available Shift:

2nd Shift 2:30 pm - 10:30 pm3rd Shift 10:30 pm - 6:30 am



Overtime: Candidates must be available to work Overtime and weekends as needed. Overtime is paid 1.5 and double on Sundays

Starting Pay: Pay will differ depending of the Level of Experience. Pay range starts at $29.14 - $35.75 (Pay rate includes $1.00 differential pay for working 2nd or 3rd Shift)

Benefits:

Key Responsibilities

Robotic knowledge, inclusive of:

Troubleshooting and repair of all associated robotic equipmentInterface peripheral equipmentAbility to learn new robotic systems



Knowledge of PLC’s

Programming and interfacing with multiple networksAbility to learn new controls and automated systemsSafety plc’s processKnowledge of automated Resistance welding equipmentKnowledge of Hydraulic Theory and application associated with Press equipmentTroubleshoot electrical control systemsWillingness and ability to learn and maintain new equipment with new technology



Major Responsibilities

Knowledge of Press Controls systemsKnowledge of automated Resistance welding equipment and MIG (metal inert gas) welding equipment.Knowledge of motion controls and equipmentComplete understanding of operation of clutch and brake assemblies. Must be able to disassemble and repair clutch and brake assemblies.Troubleshoot and repair hydraulic circuit components, electrical control systems, gear, belt, and chain drives.Disassemble and repair shaft bearings and seal assembliesAbility to assist other team members in development of personal skills and growth within the departmentInstall production and support equipment in conjunction with moderate fabrication and rigging in conjunction with Engineering and Production with minimum or no supervision



Key Qualifications/Requirements

2 years minimumCourse work in Electrical, Hydraulics, and Pneumatic principal and theoryExperience in maintaining and improving fully automated assembly equipment Experience in maintaining and improving Hydraulic and Mechanical Presses and all associated equipment 



Training Requirements:

Technical training in the following areasHydraulic/pneumatic system maintenance and repairIntermediate to Advance PLC programming and trouble shootingMechanical power transmission maintenance and repairCombustion gas train maintenance and repairHVAC maintenance and repairIndustrial electronicsWelding and fabricationMachine tool operation, maintenance and repair



Additional Information

Skills:

Individual must observe all safety regulations to insure own and others’ safetyAbility to read, write, and speak EnglishAbility to use precise measuring equipmentExcellent teamwork skills requiredIndividual must furnish basic personal tools for use at workAbility to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals



Equipment/Tools:

Hand tools and test equipmentPortable welding and grinding equipmentDrills, saws, ladders, & machine shop equipmentForklift, genie boom, & overhead cranePrecise measuring equipment



Working Conditions:

Ability to move throughout the plantExtended sitting and standing; reaching and bending.Occasional lifting of up to 40 lbs. may be requiredLoud work environment; compliance with personal protective equipment as required



Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.company_information: Cosma International provides a range of body, chassis, and engineering solutions to global customers. Magna International Inc.'s division, Eaglebend Manufacturing, is hiring a Maintenance Industrial Machine Repair Tech for their Assembly Department.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Magna is committed to being an equal opportunity employer, hiring based on experience and qualifications without discrimination based on color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.
